automaton

Class Automaton

  • java.lang.Object
    • automaton.Automaton

  • public class Automaton
extends java.lang.Object
    Automaton class, allow you to create an Automaton with State
    See Also:
    AutomatonBuilder, AutomatonExporter

    • Constructor Detail

      • Automaton

        public Automaton(State initialState,
                 java.util.List<State> finalStates)
        Constructor of Automaton. Construct an Automaton with an Initial State and a List of Final State
        Parameters:
        initialState - the Initial State
        finalStates - the List of Final State

      • Automaton

        public Automaton()
        Constructor of Automaton. Construct an Automaton by just instancing the list of Final State as an ArrayList not recommended, it is mostly used by AutomatonBuilder

      • setFinalStates

        public void setFinalStates(java.util.List<State> finalStates)
        Allow you to reset the List of Final State
        Parameters:
        finalStates - the new List of Final State you want to give

      • containFinalState

        public boolean containFinalState(State finalS)
        Test if the State given is one of the Final State of the Automaton
        Parameters:
        finalS - the State you want to test
        Returns:
        true if the List of Final State contains the State given, return false otherwise

      • addFinalState

        public void addFinalState(State finalS)
        Allow you to add a State to the List of Final State
        Parameters:
        finalS - the State you want to add

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String showing the Automaton and his Initial and Final State and all the States and there transition between don't confuse with the needed syntax of an automaton file, please see AutomatonBuilder
